info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 7:01PM EDT until July 24 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Washington County in east central New York... Northeastern Rensselaer County in east central New York... Southern Bennington County in southern Vermont... Southwestern Windham County in southern Vermont... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 700 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hoosick Falls, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Stratton, Shaftsbury, Wilmington, Cambridge, West Wardsboro, Hoosick, Lee, White Creek, Easton, North Bennington, Dover, Marlboro, Jamaica, Wardsboro, Valley Falls, Woodford and Old Bennington. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
